body:
Problem: Currently, there are three different ways of marking an option as hidden, `enable_if = false`, `hidden = true` and `immutalbe = true`. These also have different behaviors. Options hidden with `enable_if = false` can't have their value fetched using Vim script or the API, but options hidden with `hidden = true` or `immutable = true` can. On the other hand, options with `hidden = true` do not error when trying to set their value, but options with `immutable = true` do.

Solution: Remove `enable_if = false`, remove the `hidden` property for options, and use `immutable = true` to mark an option as hidden instead. Also make hidden option variable pointers always point to the default value, which allows fetching the value of every hidden option using Vim script and the API. This does also mean that trying to set a hidden option will now give an error instead of just being ignored.

comment_data.body:
if this is going to be an enum, can "hidden" also be expressed in the same enum? Perhaps this should just be part of `OptTypeFlags` ?

```suggestion
  OptType2 hidde;   ///< option hidden and/or immutable.
```
`exists('+option')` should probably return `false` for `immutable` option as well, but may that can be done in another PR.
Should `false` be removed from the type annotation of `enable_if` now?

Should it? The way I see it, `immutable` options are options that do exist, but just cannot have their value changed. The way I implemented it, options could be set to `immutable` temporarily as well, if we ever want them to not be changed.
Hmm, I don't think this matters much for now.
should we add an `p->var != NULL` here ? and the other functions where `p->var == NULL` was being checked.

> should we add an `p->var != NULL` here ? and the other functions where `p->var == NULL` was being checked.

`p->var` cannot be NULL anymore as hidden options now point to their default value, unless something has gone seriously wrong during option generation

the comments are helpful, but might as well pass them as messages too
```suggestion
  assert(not o.hidden or not o.varname, 'hidden options cannot have a varname')
  assert(not o.enable_if or not o.hidden, 'enable_if cannot be used with hidden')
```

comment_regular_data.body: Seems like a nice simplification. Do we have tests for all the affected options?

> Seems like a nice simplification. Do we have tests for all the affected options?

Yes, we have tests for `'maxcombine'`, which is now a hidden option, so that should cover everything

I made some new changes here with regards to `immutable` options. Specifically, I made it so that `immutable` options can have a value that's not its `def_val`. This was already the case in `gen_options.lua`, but was not reflected in the C code.

> allow fetching the value of a hidden option using Vim script and the API.

This is changing the semantics of hidden options. 

- that is the main change of this PR, it's totally different than the PR title (which just sounds like a refactor)
-  `:help hidden-options` would need to be updated.
- now what is the difference vs immutable options, exactly?

> > allow fetching the value of a hidden option using Vim script and the API.
> 
> This is changing the semantics of hidden options.

This change was suggested by @bfredl, so I think he can explain the reasoning better

> * that is the main change of this PR, it's totally different than the PR title (which just sounds like a refactor)

I'll change the PR and commit title, then.

> * `:help hidden-options` would need to be updated.

👍🏼 

> * now what is the difference vs immutable options, exactly?

As for the difference vs immutable options, immutable options are options that exist but can't be changed. This could also be set as a temporary flag for an option if we ever want to disallow changing the value of an option. Trying to change an immutable option will give an error, unlike hidden options where trying to change it is just ignored.

That means we are removing the main "feature" of hidden options. Now the only remaining difference is that hidden options don't error if set. The purpose of that was to avoid bothering users that might have some old lines in their configs.

```
pastetoggle
aleph
browsedir
guioptions
guitabtooltip
imcmdline
imdisable
mouseshape
opendevice
pastetoggle
termencoding
```

Rather than continuing to maintain what is now a very narrow difference for these 10 "hidden" options, we can just treat them as immutable.

And we can later decide whether immutable options should error or not. But that can be a separate PR, if at all.
